SourceString:
Use <emoji FaceButton_Right> to talk
to people or investigate things.

A cursor will appear when you get close to something
that you can interact with,
so use it as a guide to investigate various things.

If you're out adventuring and find yourself unsure of where
to go, take a glance at the map and look for anyone marked
with a <emoji Fukidashi_Icon>.
They might have helpful hints about your next destination.

You'll find the map displayed in the bottom-left corner of
the screen. For a broader view, you can access a larger map
with <emoji FaceButton_Left>.

In fields and towns, there are locations where you can
navigate by climbing up and down
using ropes, ladders, and more.

Let's explore these areas more closely.

If you come across a shimmering spot in the field,
you may discover an item, so let's take a closer look:

Upon collecting the shimmering item, it vanishes,
but as you navigate the map or time elapses,
it will reappear, allowing you to collect it once more.

By visiting the priest or sister at the church,
you can document your adventures in your adventure book.

Recording your progress allows you to resume
your adventure from where you left off,
so make sure to check in with them regularly.

Auto-save may trigger during your adventure.

Please do not turn off the power or reset the game
while 'Auto Saved' is displayed at the bottom right.

Even if you forget to document your progress
and your adventure is interrupted,
you can still resume from the autosave.

Up to 4 people can participate in a battle.
These members are referred to as party members.

A companion who does not participate in battle is put on
standby, and can be changed using 'Swap' in the battle menu.

Even if a party member is on standby, they will receive the
same amount of experience points.

Adjust the combination of party members accordingly,
depending on the status of allies and the monsters you face.

You can adjust the camera direction using <emoji RightStick>.
To align the camera with the
direction your character is facing,
simply press the <emoji RightStickButton> button.

By pressing <emoji LeftShoulder> in the field or a town,
you can continuously run in the direction you're facing.

While running, you can adjust your direction using <emoji LeftStick>
and jump using <emoji FaceButton_Bottom>.

To ride the dolboard in the field, simply press <emoji LeftTrigger>.
It allows you to travel much faster than walking,
making it ideal for covering long distances.

To dismount the dolboard, press <emoji LeftTrigger> while riding it.
Press <emoji RightTrigger> in a field or town to open the quick menu.\nYou can access important items and commands from there.

In 'System Settings' you can
adjust various in-game configurations.

Whether you need to modify initial settings,
auto-save preferences, and more.

As you embark on an adventure, friends may join you.
There are friends who join you temporarily
and others who will fight alongside you forever after.

Temporary party members cannot be recruited,
will not grow, and cannot change equipment
or acquire new skills.

The party members who remain with you permanently
will gain experience points and
level up by winning battles,
just like the main character.
As their level increases, they will gain skill points,
so set up their skill panels and help them grow.

You can also change your allies' weapons and armor.
Unlike the main character, their appearance
will not change according to their armor, but
weapons and armor will still be effective, so
don't forget to equip your allies.

If you find stylish equipment for your party members,
you can change their appearance from the equip screen.
Please keep an eye out for it.

You and your party members will act according to
the 'Tactics' set for each.

If you select 'Tactics' from the 'Misc' menu,
you can change the 'Tactics' of your friends or yourself.

'Tactics' can also be changed during battle.
If you press <emoji FaceButton_Top> during battle, the
'Tactics' menu will open during your turn and
you can make changes.

If you select 'Follow orders' in 'Tactics',
you can concretely decide actions during battle, such as
spells, special skills, attack targets, etc.

If you want someone to act by themselves,
try selecting 'Fight Wisely'.

By raising your level or unlocking skill panels,
you can learn special moves called 'Coup De Graces'.

When tension reaches a certain amount in battle,
a new option called 'Specials' will appear
in the command menu.

If you select it, you can choose from
the Coup De Graces you currently know and use them.

Each uses a different amount of tension.
When used, your tension will drop by that amount.

A special move that only the hero princess Anlucia can use.

Eliminates one opponent's advantageous effects, including
Curses. Inflicts damage and immobilizes the opponent.

Because it is so powerful, Anlucia will become tired and
unable to move, so you need to be careful when using it.

Also, Anlucia may become excited as she fights against
the power of darkness.

A special move that only the hero princess Anlucia can use.

It can discern illusions and also lower
the opponent's elemental resistance.

It can eliminate enemy clones.

If you lose sight of the enemy's main body, try using it.

A special move that only the hero princess Anlucia can use.

It grants all allies a brief period of
protection from any attack once.

When you sense that the opponent is about to use a powerful technique, don't hesitate to use it.

A special move that only the hero princess Anlucia can use.

It grants courage to all allies and
repels negative effects.
It can help weak allies who cannot withstand damage
to stand strong with this technique.

Since it also affects allies in reserve,
let's strategically utilize substitutions in battle.

Under the fortune teller vocation,
you can use Monster Tarot during battle.

When the battle starts, four monster tarot cards are
dealt from the equipped deck.
You can use one piece by selecting the 'Tarot' command.

The effect when used varies greatly depending on the zn'Arcana', 'Monster', and 'Rank' on the Monster Tarot.

The deck is randomly shuffled each time you enter a battle.
The order in which the Monster Tarot appears
changes each time.

Battle members can be replaced with
standby allies during battle using 'Swap'.

However, the replaced member cannot act during their turn.
Consider the timing of party member swapping carefully.

When all battle members are activated,
standby allies will appear and join the battle.
If you select 'Equip', you can\nswap what you have equipped with\nwhat is in your item bag even during battle.

You can resume the adventure from
any of the following points:
-'Last place you saved'
-'Last place you visited'
-'From autosave'

When you return to the last place you prayed or
the last place you visited, the experience points and
items you obtained will remain the same,
but the money you have will be halved.

Upon returning to the auto-saved location,
your EXP and money will be returned to their original state.

The money you deposit in the Gold Bank
will not decrease in any case,
so it's recommended that you bank as much as possible.

When you feel like running away during a battle,
use <emoji FaceButton_Top> to open the menu and select 'Flee'.
There is a probability that you can run away.

If you fail, the character who chose 'Flee'
will be unable to act for that turn.

You can change battle speed during battle
from 'Settings' in 'Misc'.

This is recommended for
those who want to advance battles quickly.

This setting does not provide
any advantage or disadvantage in battle.

'HP'
Abbreviation for hit points.
It decreases each time you receive damage.
When it reaches zero, you will faint.

'MP'
Abbreviation for magic power.
Consumed when using spells or abilities.
If you don't have enough MP,
you can't use a spell or an ability.

'Max HP'
Maximum value of HP.

'Max MP'
Maximum value of MP.

'Attack'
If you have high Attack Power,
the damage dealt by physical attacks
such as weapon attacks will increase.

'Defense'
If your Defense is high,
damage received from physical attacks will be reduced.

'Magical Might'
The higher the Magical Might is,
the more powerful your attack spells become.

'Magical Mending'
The higher the Magical Mending is,
the more HP recovery spells will recover.
It also increases the probability that
a resurrection spell will be successful.

'Strength'
The basic strength value
excluding effects such as equipment and skills.

'Resilience'
The basic defense power value
excluding effects such as equipment and skills.

'Agility'
If agility is high, you will have a higher chance of
being able to attack first during battle.
Also increases your dodge rate of enemy attacks.

'Deftness'
If deftness is high, you will have a higher chance of
launching a first strike at the start of battle.

'Charm'
If Charm is high, you have a better chance of
enemies being infatuated by you during battle.
Enemies who are charmed cannot act on the next turn.

'Sleep'
When you physically attack a sleeping enemy,
they often wake up, but
they are less likely to wake up when
spells and non-physical attacks are used.

'Dazzle'
When affected by dazzle, normal attacks are
more likely to fail, but spells and
other attacks are unaffected.

'Charm'
Allies affected by confusion or charm
may attack party members.
It's dangerous not to recover quickly.

'Poison'
When poisoned, you take damage each turn in battle.
The effect continues after battle,
with damage occurring every few seconds.
It will eventually heal, but it's recommended to
recover with items or spells.

'Curse'
When cursed, you may be unable to
act on your turn during battle.
Some items or special skills can remove it,
but when there's no other option,
go to a church to have it lifted.

When you receive damage during battle or use tools,
your 'Tension' will increase, and
the tension gauge displayed to the
left side of your face icon will rise.

If you learn Coup De Graces, you can use
the accumulated tension to execute powerful special moves.

The amount of tension consumed differs depending on
the Coup De Grace, so use it wisely.

Also, when your tension reaches its maximum,
you enter a state of Super High Tension, where
the damage of all attacks and the amount of recovery
when using skills and spells increase.

Some special moves can be used as much as you like.
The Super High Tension state will be cancelled when you
use a special move that consumes 100% of the tension,
or after a certain number of turns have passed.

At which point, Super High Tension will be released,
and the tension will return to 0.

However, if the battle ends while you are in
a state of Super High Tension, the state will
continue into the next battle, so don't panic.

Your tension will increase at various other times,
so use it wisely to gain an advantage in battle.

Note: The Super High Tension state is
sometimes abbreviated as SHT in explanatory texts.

With the forge, you can create equipment
using recipes and materials, or repair and
enhance existing gear.

There are some equipment pieces
that can only be acquired by forging.

Recipes can be found in bookshelves and shops,
while materials are gathered from various points.
If you spot shimmering spots or bookshelves, investigate.
You can also buy some recipe ingredients from shops.

The fundamental process of forging
involves shaping the raw material of the equipment
by heating the material, bashing
and plunging it into cold water.

As you bash, the blue gauge will fill up, so
try to stop it within the green 'success zone'.

Moreover, stopping at the marker within the center
of the success zone will turn the gauge yellow
and illuminate the marker, potentially yielding
superior results.

When you use 'Bash' or 'Skills',
your 'concentration' will decrease, and
when you deplete your concentration, you will
no longer be able to continue forging.

Be careful of your remaining concentration
when choosing the command.

As your forging level increases,
your forging skills will also improve:
the number of forging skills you can use and
your concentration points will increase.

Even when using the same technique,
the higher the 'temperature' of the material,
the greater the power of each strike.

When you strike the material, its temperature drops, and
when it gets cold, strikes will no longer be effective.

It seems that some 'skills' can adjust
the temperature of the material or
hit multiple times at once.

Use them well and aim for 'perfection'.

If you choose to 'Rework an Item',
you can challenge yourself to improve the quality
of your equipment.

This will consume 'Perfectionist Pearls'.

Even if you fail, your equipment will not break;
If you succeed, the resulting equipment will be
superior to the original.

Occasionally, while forging,
a 'Master Stroke' will be triggered,
allowing the forge's special technique,
'Flame of Hephaestus' to be used.
However, it can only be used once per forging session.
After use, if you forge the material with
'Bash' or 'Skills', it will become a 'Critical hit',
greatly increasing the power of the strike.

Even if the power exceeds the success zone,
the gauge will always stop at the center of the success zone.

Be cautious as the effect will end
even if the next action after using the
special move does not strengthen the material,
such as raising the temperature.

From the 'Item' menu, selecting 'Alchemy pot'
allows you to alchemize new consumables
using multiple items as ingredients.

When you select the item you want to create from the
'What do you want to make?' menu and have the
'Required materials', alchemy begins immediately,
and you receive the new item.

If you lack the 'Required materials', they will be displayed
in gray and cannot be selected.

Recipes that expand these options can be obtained from
sources such as bookshelves and
recipe books sold in shops.

Materials can be obtained from gathering points
 or purchased at shops.

The Traveler's Bazaar sometimes has
special items for sale that are not sold at other stores.

The products will change from time to time, so
please check out the Traveler's Bazaar frequently!

When you talk to an Alltrades Abbey priest in a tavern
or similar place, you can undergo a 'job change'
to change your class.

When you change jobs, your level will reset to
the corresponding level of that vocation, but
the levels you've gained and the
skills you've acquired so far are recorded.

So when you change back to your original vocation,
you can resume from that level.

Furthermore, job-specific skills cannot be used in
other vocations, but skills like 'purification' learned
by raising the level of a Martial artist can be used
in any vocation once learned.

Additionally, some status enhancement effects such as:
'strength +10' learned by raising a warrior's level,
or 'MP +20' learned by priests or mages
are inherited in other occupations,
so experience various classes and become stronger!

You can keep scouted companion monsters
at the monster tavern.

Additionally, you can swap the current companion monster
with another that you have entrusted in their care.

At the 'Adventurer's Tavern', you can sign up and
send a 'friend's gift', or redeem a
'friend's gift' you've received from another.

You can even have your own tab registered.

Upon registration, you can
attach a single request form of your choice.

Likewise, if the 'Friend's Gift' you've received
has a request form attached,
you can fulfil it yourself.

At the 'Accessory Synthesizer' found in Verinard Castle Town,
you can merge the effects of similar accessories,
consolidating them into a single accessory.

While a single accessory can hold a maximum of 3 effects,
there are extra effects available for accessories
aside from the 'composite effect'.

Once accessories are merged,
they cannot be separated, so
consider your choices carefully before synthesis.

Talking to Dorothy in the north of Rendoor
and handing over the labyrinth coins you have
allows you to enter the 'Magic Labyrinth'
where you can battle various bosses.

You can find out which monsters appear
by the name of the labyrinth coin or by
checking 'Details'.

There are monsters that can only be fought
in the 'Magic Labyrinth' and items
that can only be obtained here,
so keep challenging yourself.

Rest assured that labyrinth coins
will not be lost even if you lose
in battles in the 'Magic Labyrinth'.

You can obtain labyrinth coins through draws
or create them up to the trading post
if you have recipes and materials.

There are a total of six mausoleums
hidden within the pyramids
scattered across the continent of Lendersia.

Upon inspecting the coffin inside each mausoleum,
the guardians of the treasure will emerge,
initiating their battle.

Once the battle commences,
you must either vanquish all the treasure guardians,
face a party wipeout, or
opt to 'give up' during the encounter.
Exiting the mausoleum is not an option.

Defeating all the treasure guardians grants you access to
exclusive accessories and materials found only within.
Strive to conquer all the mausoleums.

Talking to Dorothy in the north of Rendoor,
you can hand over the labyrinth coins you possess
and gain access to the 'Magic Labyrinth',
where you can battle various bosses.

You can find out which monsters appear
by checking the name of the labyrinth coin or by
examining them in detail.

Since there are monsters that can only be battled
in the 'Magic Labyrinth' and items that are exclusive
to this place,
feel free to challenge it repeatedly.

Rest assured that labyrinth coins
won't be lost even if you're defeated
in battles within the 'Magic Labyrinth'.

You can obtain labyrinth coins through draws
or craft them up to the trading post
if you have recipes and materials.

'Monster Battle Road' is a competition where
a party composed solely of companion monsters engages
opposing teams within the 'Monster Fighting Arena'.

You can join 'Monster Battle Road' at the reception counter
of the 'Monster Battle Arena' provided you
have four companion monsters.

To acquire companion monsters,
you need to switch jobs to either 'Magic Hand' or
'Double Hand' and scout the monster you wish to befriend.

Victory in 'Monster Battle Road' awards you
Battle Road Points and Battle Road Coins, enabling you to
participate in rank-up exams.

You can further boost the capabilities of your
companion monsters by equipping them with badges.

Badges are obtainable through
the exchange of Battle Road Coins.

At the 'Beauty Salon', you can
alter your character's appearance and indulge in fashion.

You can modify the color of your hair or skin,
including options which were unavailable initially.

If you obtain a 'Dolboard Prism' from somewhere, visit
'Custom Shop Decory' in Mount Gatara and ask them to
install it for you.

Once the 'prism' is affixed to the dolboard,
you can alter your dolboard's appearance
whenever you like by consulting 'Custom Shop Decory'.

If you obtain a 'Lottery Ticket' from somewhere,
speak to the Travel Concierge at an inn in a major town.

You can participate in the 'Lottery' once for each Ticket.
If you possess 10 or more tickets,
you can participate 10 consecutive times,
conducting 10 tries in one go.

The types and probabilities of prizes you can
win with the 'Lottery' are consistent worldwide.

Moreover, you can acquire 'Lottery Tickets'
as complimentary items while shopping at stores,
as rewards from subjugation missions,
and through various other means.

If you possess the Heaven and Mine Striker class,
you have the ability to summon
'Spirits' during battles.
The summoned 'Spirit' will position itself behind the main
character and will act automatically when its turn arrives.

There are four types of 'Spirits' that can be summoned,
each with unique characteristics, skills, and spells.

Kakaron:
Primarily focused on recovery, with defensive
strengthening spells also in its arsenal.

Kushalami:
Specializes in recovery, with attack-based
strengthening abilities also at its disposal.

Barbaroo:
While mainly geared towards physical attacks,
it also possesses special skills that reduce both attack and defense.

Domedi:
Largely relies on spell attacks and can
utilize a variety of spells.
By speaking with the 'subjugation team' in town, you can\ndispatch the friends you've enlisted at the tavern\nas your monster subjugation team to fulfill your request.

It seems that Battle Phantasm is scheduled to take place at
the Colosseum on the entertainment island of Rakkaran.

There are prerequisites for joining Battle Phantasm.
You can enter if you successfully complete all village,
town, and story-related vocation quests.

Once you meet the requirements to participate,
approach the receptionist at the Colosseum.

Fulfill quests and enhance your abilities.
Strive to claim prestigious rewards.

There are stone monuments called
'stone monuments of arrival' scattered throughout the world.
By inspecting these, you can
register a new destination in the Zoomstone.

Stone monuments that have been registered will shine, so
please be sure to visit all of them.

'Bravestone Pillars' are pentagonal stone pillars with wings
that are scattered throughout Lendersia.

By holding the Brave Stone and examining the stone pillar,
you can freely move between the True and False Lendersias.

By using the 'Zoomstone', you can
instantly travel to registered towns and fields.

Upon entering a town,
it will be automatically registered in the Zoomstone.

However, you must personally inspect stone monuments to
register locations in the overworld, so don't forget.

If you have a Zoom booster, you can
pass through overhead obstacles such as the ceiling and move with ease.
If not, you have to exit town buildings or dungeons like
caves on foot or with the Zoom spell.
Now, your adventure will be more comfortable.
Please select Zoomstone from the tool commands.

However, be cautious, as mysterious forces may
nullify the stone's effects in certain areas.

At times, in the field or a town, you may encounter
a 'ferryman' offering passage on a boat.

Upon speaking to them, they'll transport you to
another location or area free of charge.

Another ferry will also be present at
your destination, ensuring you'll have a way back.

If you possess the 'Intercontinental Rail Pass' key item,
you can journey to another continent via
the Intercontinental Railroad found at
train stations in major towns.

Speak to the 'station staff' within the station and
select your desired destination.
By paying a fee, they will facilitate your journey.

However, certain stations may have conditions for use,
so if unavailable, advance the storyline accordingly.

If you have the 'Titus boarding pass' key item,
you can ride the Grand Titus-
Pay the fee, and it will take you to your destination.

Inside the Grand Titus, you can engage
in various activities such as fishing and shopping.

You will be at your destination in no time.

If you use the 'Dragon Flute' key item,
a flying dragon will appear in response to the sound-
you can ride it and travel above Lendersia.

<emoji LeftStick> - Proceed
<emoji RightStickRotate_Up><emoji RightStickRotate_Down> - Change altitude
<emoji RightStickRotate_Left><emoji RightStickRotate_Right> - Camera rotation
<emoji LeftShoulder> - Autorun
<emoji RightShoulder> - Dash
<emoji FaceButton_Right> - Landing

There are restrictions on where the flying dragon can land.
A mark will be displayed where landing is possible.
When you see the landmark where you want to get off,
press <emoji FaceButton_Right>.

Depending on the time of day, it may get dark and
the weather may change.

It also seems that some monsters
appear depending on the time of day and weather.

At the inn, you can rest until night or
stay until morning.

You may be able to obtain items by
examining pots and chests placed in towns and buildings.

You can check the treasures you have obtained in the
'List of acquired treasures' in the 'Records' menu.

If you select 'Heal All' on the menu screen,
it will use MP to fully restore everyone's HP.

If you know a spell that can cure status ailments,
you can revive your allies while under attack, and
you can also recover from conditions like poison.

Additionally, if you choose 'Handy Heal All' from 'Misc',
HP will be restored efficiently, helping you conserve MP.

Utilize these options to manage your MP effectively, but
if you run out of MP midway,
you'll only be able to heal up to that point.

While the menu screen is open, press the <emoji FaceButton_Left> button
to trigger 'Heal All' as well.

While adventuring, you'll come across various items.

Items fall into different categories:

'consumables', which grant effects when used;

'equipment', providing benefits when worn;

'materials', used for crafting tools and equipment.

Items crucial to your adventure are called 'key items'.
These cannot be discarded or sold.

Additionally, certain items are
automatically stored in your 'Item Bag'.

If you choose 'Items' on the menu screen, you can view
the details of the items you possess and utilize them.

Items with effects can be activated by selecting the
item in this menu and confirming with 'Use'.

If your inventory is full, you can select the
item from this menu and select 'Discard' to remove it.

There's a cap on the number of items storable in
your 'Consumables', yet through your adventures,
you may enhance your carrying capacity.

Some items that are used
at special facilities or for exchange
will automatically be placed in the 'Item Bag'.

From this menu, you can check the quantity of
items collected and view their details.

Simply possessing equipment won't yield any benefits,
so ensure proper equipment usage through the menu.

In the 'Equipment' section, you can
equip or unequip items stored in your 'Item Bag'
or those worn by your companions.
Certain equipment may have usage restrictions.

Furthermore, there's a capacity limit for
items stored in your 'Item Bag,' yet
you might expand your carrying capacity as
your adventure progresses.

In the 'Equip Now' option of the 'Equipment' menu,
you can quickly equip yourself with weapons and armor.

Navigate to 'Equip Now' and use <emoji DPad_RightLeft> or <emoji LeftStickRotate_Left><emoji LeftStickRotate_Right>
to optimize for 'Attack', 'Defense', or 'Magic'.

The displayed equipment options for all equipment slots
except accessories will be highlighted in light blue.

Press <emoji FaceButton_Right> to immediately equip the selected item.
Items already equipped by allies
won't be available for selection.

If you're a fortune teller, you can
alter your equipped deck or inspect the decks you possess
through 'Monster Tarot' in the 'Equipment' menu.

Each deck contains different contents, so please
adjust your equipment accordingly to the situation.

Press the <emoji FaceButton_Top> button
in the 'Equip' menu to open 'Glamour'.

Glamour is a function that allows you to register your
favorite combination of equipment as a single outfit.

If you wear the registered Glamour,
you can change your appearance to the
equipment set without changing your current strength.

Even if the equipment used in Glamour disappears,
the appearance registered in Glamour can be used as is.

With the map open on <emoji FaceButton_Left>,
press <emoji FaceButton_Right> to open the 'Map Menu'.

This handy menu offers various conveniences, including:

- Navigational guidance for your next destination
- Scoping the map around your current location
- Tracking the whereabouts of your character.

The main character can pursue a variety of vocations
other than the one initially chosen.

Switching your vocation is referred to as 'Job Change'.
You can change your job by speaking with
the Alltrades Abbey priest at a bar in town.

Each vocation comes with its unique traits,
including stats and special skills that can be acquired.

As you progress in different jobs,
additional vocations may become available.

As you gain battle experience and level up,
you may acquire skill points.

By utilizing these skill points, you can
acquire a range of abilities and spells to
strengthen both yourself and your allies.

To learn a new skill,
allocate points on the 'Skill Panel' in 'Misc'.

In the 'Skill Panel' menu, you can
allocate acquired skill points to
learn new abilities and spells.

Also, when you learn them,
adjacent panels will unlock and
the number of skills you can learn will increase.

You can also reset your skills at any time.

You can use 'Skill Reset' in the 'Skill Panel' to reset
the skill points you have allocated.

Skill points will return when resetting skills.
Each point costs 20 gold.

Additionally, you can reset your skills at any time.
Omit

If you select 'Records' from the menu, you can
view a record of your adventures,
including the items you've obtained
and the monsters you've defeated,
as well as the treasure chests you've opened so far.

As you advance through your adventure, you may
encounter opportunities known as 'quests.'

These quests come in various forms, and upon completion,
you'll receive rewards, and even additional benefits.

Look for a purple <emoji Question_Icon> above characters who offer quests,
then speak to them to accept the task.

To view quests available for acceptance or completed ones,
consult the 'Quest List' within the 'Records' menu.

To partake in casino games, you'll need 'casino coins'.
These can be acquired from the coin shop
at a rate of 20 gold per coin.

Inside the main area of the casino,
the northern section accommodates games played with 1 coin,
while the southern section hosts games played with 10 coins.

Towards the rear, there's an exclusive VIP room
where the stakes are set at 100 coins per game.
Until you're accustomed,
it's advisable to start with lower-stake areas.

The 'casino coins' you earn can be swapped for
prizes at the prize exchange office,
including exclusive, luxury rewards unique to the casino.

Select an available poker table and choose
'Yes' to start playing poker.
Swap the dealt five cards to form winning hands!
Set the coin denomination, then hit Start.
After the cards are dealt, decide which cards to 'Keep' and
which to 'Exchange,' then select 'Deal' to swap cards once.
When you achieve a winning hand,
you can challenge the 'Double Up.'

When you form a winning hand in poker,
you can challenge the Double Up.
Try to guess a card stronger than
the one on the left from among four cards.
If you win the Double Up, the coins you receive will double,
but if you lose, you'll lose the coins gained in this game.
Let's aim to become a poker master
while discerning the right moment to stop!

When challenging the Double Up, occasionally
a 'treasure chest' with several locks may appear.
If you win the Double Up once,
you can break one lock.

What is 'Draconian Quest'?

It's a setting where you can embark on the adventure with
various restrictions, such as:
'You cannot equip armor',
or 'Harder enemies'.

You can establish these conditions when
creating an adventure book or when new content is added.

You can also activate multiple
Draconian Quests simultaneously, but
you'll need to clear them one by one as they become
common across all adventure books.

Additionally, if you wish to abandon your quest midway,
you can do so at the church.

Even upon quitting, you can resume your
journey without any restrictions, though
you won't be able to reapply Draconian Quest restrictions.

Feeling bold?
Consider experimenting with different Draconian Quests!

You can give up at anytime using the church's
'Draconian Quest Cancellation' option.

Once cancelled, you can proceed with
your adventure unrestricted, but
you won't be able to set it again.

After some playtime,
new options for 'System Settings' and
'Draconian Quest Settings' will be unlocked.

The 'Draconian Quest Display' setting
allows Draconian Quests to be showcased on the
screen while in-game.

Consider utilizing this
when sharing your gameplay with friends.

Once you've vanquished the story's boss monster and
witnessed the ending, you'll gain the ability to
learn the 'Spell of Restoration' at the church.

By incorporating this 'Spell of Restoration' into your
Dragon Quest experience, you can
unlock new games and features.

Upon activating Double Bubble, you'll enter
'Double Time' for 30 minutes.

During 'Double Time', experience points and gold
earned in battles are doubled for the entire party.

This bonus can be stacked with other items that
boost experience points, such as meals and Angel Slime Hats.

However, using two Double Bubbles within the time limit
won't yield additional benefits.

Therefore, it's crucial to consider usage,
as subsequent activations within the duration will
merely overwrite the current timer.
